page.title: 08THE WOOKEY HOLE PAPER MILL
page.content: ONE OF THE ATTRACTIONS OF WOOKEY HOLE IS THE HAND MADE PAPER FROM THE MILL.PAPER WAS BEING MADE BEFORE 1610 AND YOU CAN STILL SEE IT BEING MADE TODAY.YEARS AGO RAGS WERE USED, BUT NOW COTTON FIBRE IS IMPORTED FROM NORTH CAROLINA;OTHERWISE LITTLE HAS CHANGED. . THE CLEAN COTTON FIBRE IS PREPARED IN THE BEATER AND IS THEN CALLED "STUFF" WHICH IS FED IN PIPES TO THE HIGHLY SKILLED PAPERMAKER AT HIS VAT. HE DIPS HIS MOULD INTO THE STUFF AND SHAKES IT FORWARDS AND SIDEWAYS TO LAY THE FIBRES ACROSS EACH OTHER.EACH SHEET OF PAPER IS LAID BETWEEN FELT AND PUT INTO A VICTORIAN PRESS.LATER THE PAPER IS DRIED. THE INTRICATE WATERMARKS ARE ALWAYS FASCINATING AND ARE FORMED BY WIRE IN THE MOULDING FRAME.
